result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Faith Hope Poppele
Current: 216 W Center Street, Juneau, WI 53039 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)

12:50 PM Defendant Faith Hope Poppele appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Van Kerkvoorde appears by video (Eligible). Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $1000 cash bond with conditions: The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license.
Review hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
